name: Vagabond
description: Cardinal Red. Medium, single. Average growth. M. (Aus. 1971 - Tuckfield).

name: Val Bieleski
description: Salmon Pink fading to Lighter Pink. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading growth. M-L. (Sport of Reticulata hybrid 'Valentine Day'). (N.Z. 2000 - Haydon).

name: Val Parker
description: Deep Red. Large, semidouble, generally with small narrow petals standing upright and with surrounding stamens. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - Haynie).

name: Vale Beauty
description: White shading Pink in outer petals. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact upright growth. M. (Aus. 1977 - Camellia Vale Nsy., Bexley North, NSW).

name: Vale Mist
description: White. Small, semidouble.

name: Vale Princess
description: Light Lavender Pink. Medium, semidouble with fluted petals.

name: Vale Queen
description: Iridescent Pink. Very large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Willow Wand' × Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (Aus. 1977 - Camellia Vale Nsy., Bexley North, NSW).

name: Vale Sunset
description: Dark Red. Medium, rose form double to peony form. Average, dense, spreading growth. M. (Aus. 1977 - Camellia Vale Nsy., Bexley North, NSW).

name: Valentine Ball
description: Mauve Pink with Yellow anthers and Pale Pink filaments. Medium to large, full peony. Average, upright, open growth. E-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tar Baby'. (U.S. 2019 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Valentine Day
description: Salmon Pink. Large to very large, formal double with Rosebud center. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' × Japonica "Tiffany'). (U.S. 1969 - Asper).

name: Valentine Day Variegated
description: Salmon Pink and White form of 'Valentine Day'. (U.S. 1975).

name: Valerie
description: Metallic Red. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1959 - Wells).

name: Valley Dee
description: White, sometimes streaked faint, soft Pink. Medium, loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Brodies Nsy., Biloxi, MS).

name: Valley Dee Blush
description: Very Light Purple with darker veining and White patches on some petals with Light Yellow anthers. Medium, loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Valley Dee').

name: Valley Knudsen
description: Deep Orchid Pink. Medium to large, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis × Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha'). (U.S. 1958 - Asper).

name: Valtevareda
description: Pink shading to deeper Pink on outer petals. Medium, formal double of cupped form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. L. (Italy 1853 - Rossi.

name: Valtevareda Variegated
description: Pink blotched White form of "Valtevareda'.

name: Van Hardee
description: Red. Medium, full peony form. Average, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - Van Hardee, Madison, FL).

name: Vanda
description: Pale Crimson. Small, formal double. Average, open upright growth. M. (Aus. 1969 - A. E. Campbell, St. Ives, NSW).

name: Vanilla Cream
description: Creamy White with Gold anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form. Average, spreading, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Betty Sheffield Supreme'). (U.S. 2021 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Vanilla Moon
description: Blush Pink with White anthers and White filaments. Small, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (Seedling of Hybrid 'Yume'). (U.S. 2016 - Tsubaki Camellias, Savannah, GA).

name: Vannate
description: Oriental Red. Medium to large, single with heavy textured petals. Slow, bushy growth. M. (Japonica 'Lady Vansittart' x Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (U.S. 1968 - Feathers).

name: Vannine
description: White to White striped Pink to Pink. Medium to large, semidouble. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (Japonica 'Lady Vansittart' × Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (U.S. 1968 - Feathers). "VERMILLION PURPLE GOWN - Reticulata - ('Zhusha Zipao' - Chinese Name). Oriental Red. Very large, loose peony form. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China To U.S. 1980 - U. C. Bot. Gdn, CA).

name: Variegata
description: Deep Rose Pink mottled White. Medium, semidouble. Spreading growth. M. (China to England [Chandler] 1792).

name: Variety Z
description: Dark Pink (RHS 62A); the petaloids are Light Pink (RHS 62C) with Creamy White anthers and White filaments. Medium, rose form double to formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2009 - P. W. Zimmerman and Boyce Thompson, Yonkers, NY).

name: Vashti
description: White splotched and striped Pink with occasional Red flowers. Medium, rose form double. Average, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1945 - F. L. Gibson, Thomasville, GA).

name: Vaughn Drinkard
description: Light Salmon to Dark Rose and White. (Variegated variation of Japonica 'Dona Julia'). (U.S. 1955 - Longview).

name: Vedrine
description: ('Ruby Glow'; 'Margaret Lawrence'; 'Bolen's Pride'; 'Cleo Wittie'; 'Mrs. T. R. McKenzie'; 'Mehl's Red'; 'Payne's Red'; 'Lewis Red Peony'). Ruby Red. Medium to large, anemone to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Dr. Robert E. Schwartz'). (U.S. Early 1900's - Mary Swords Debaillon, Lafayette, LA).

name: Veiled Beauty
description: Clear Rose to Light Pink center petals. Large, rose form double to loose peony form. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1968 - Haynie).

name: Velma Grantham
description: White to Blush Pink with Pink flecks and stripes, sporting Blush, Dark Pink, White striped Pink and Blush bordered Deep Rose. Medium to large, semidouble with upright petals. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - A. Grantham, Bogalusa, LA).

name: Velma Grantham Blush
description: Blush Pink sometimes with Deeper Blush border. (Sport of Japonica 'Velma Grantham').

name: Velma Grantham Pink
description: Pink. (Sport of Japonica 'Velma Grantham').

name: Velma Grantham Variegated
description: Pink flecked, blotched and moired White variation of 'Velma Grantham'.

name: Velvet Brocade
description: Cranberry Red. Medium, formal double form with tiny incurved petals which sometimes show White tips. Vigorous, upright, open growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Beatrix Hoyt'). (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Velvet Glow
description: White. Large, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1961 - R. W. Wilder, Fairhope, AL).

name: Vera Curry
description: Light Pink with Darker Pink stripes. Small, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Lady Laura'). (U.S. 2019 - Jim Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: Vera Harper
description: Pastel Pink, petals darker to the edges and have a few Red stripes. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, spreading growth. E. (U.S. 2005 - John W. Shirah, Lakeland, FL).

name: Vergine Di Colle Beato
description: ('Virgine Calubini'; 'Virgin of the Blessed Hill'). White. Medium, formal double with six to seven geometric swirls in either clockwise or counter clockwise formation. M-L. (Belgium [Versch] from Italy 1857; to U.S. from Sevesi - mid 1960's).

name: Verity Bettine
description: Pink. Medium, single.

name: Verna Halbert
description: Flesh Pink. Large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - Haynie).

name: Vernal Breeze
description: White. Small, single. Vigorous, upright growth; the plant has long arching branches. E. Very fragrant. (Japonica × C. lutchuensis). (U.S. 2014 - Camellia Forest, Chapel Hill, NC).

name: Vernice Ann
description: Rose Pink. Large, peony form. Average, open, spreading growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1975 - V. A. Meskell, San Marino, CA).

name: Vernie Koegler
description: Rose Red. Large, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1985 - Alfter).

name: Vernon E. Howell
description: Red. Large, semidouble to full peony form. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 2003 - Dudley Boudreaux, Port Neches, TX).

name: Vernon E. Howell, Jr.
description: Rose with White splotches. Large, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous. upright growth. (Seedling of Japonica 'Mary Agnes Patin'). (U.S. 2019 - Vernon E. Howell, Lucedale, MS).

name: Vernon Mayo
description: Rose Opal with Silver overcast. Large, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Tammia).

name: Vertie Leblanc
description: Light Pink center petals to Dark Pink outer petals; the bloom has occasional Dark Pink buttons in center of petals. Small to medium, formal double form. Average, upright, dense growth. M-L. (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Verve
description: Pink in center to Deeper Pink with Red petal tips. Small, semidouble. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Debutante'). (U.S. 1983 - Feathers).

name: Very Cherry
description: Very Dark Red. Large, anemone form to peony form. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1979 - W. Harmsen, Claremont, CA).

name: Vestito Rosso
description: See 'Bella Jinhua'.

name: Vi Henderson
description: Red. Very large, semidouble to peony form. Average, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' seedling). (Aus. 1976 - Sebire).

name: Vi Stone
description: Deep bright Pink veined Red and edged White. Large, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' × Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Vicki Galvin
description: Pale Pink edged Rose Pink. Large, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M. (Hybrid 'Margaret Waterhouse' × Japonica 'Great Eastern). (Aus. 1980 - M. L. Galvin, Sylvania, NSW).

name: Vicki Marie
description: Very Pale Pink. Large, peony form. Average, open, upright growth. M. (N.Z. 1992 - C. Treadwell, Wanganui).

name: Victor Corkill
description: Rose Red veined darker. Very large, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'William Hertrich' seedling). (N.Z. 1982 - A. Gamlin, Manaia).

name: Victor Emmanuel
description: See 'Blood of China'.

name: Victor Johnson
description: Bright Red. Medium, formal double. Upright, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1951 - Riverbank).

name: Victoria Dowling Beasley
description: Light Pink. Medium, semidouble with five rows of petals and top row of petals pointed. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - Beasley).

name: Victoria Martin
description: Pink with flecks of Red. Medium to large, rose form double. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 2000 - T. E. Lundy, Milton, FL).

name: Victoria Vanis
description: Light Blush Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Japonica 'April Remembered' x unknown pollen parent). (U.S. 2009 - Hal Vanis, Henderson, TX).

name: Victoria Whiddon
description: Light Pink with Golden Yellow anthers and Yellow filaments. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright • growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' x Reticulata hybrid 'Annabelle Fetterman'). (U.S. 2009 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Victorian Posy
description: Bright Rose Pink. Medium, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (N.Z. 1972 - D. G. O'Toole, Ohope).

name: Victory
description: Rose Red. Large, semidouble to full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1942 - Youtz).

name: Victory White
description: White. Medium, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1939 - Overlook).

name: Vida Davis
description: White washed Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with large petals and prominent bunched Ochre tipped stamens. (U.S. 1959).

name: Vilia
description: Soft Lavender Pink shading deeper at edge. Large, semidouble with wavy, velvet textured petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (Hybrid 'Williams Lavender' × Japonica 'Kuro-tsubaki'). (U.S. 1961 - McCaskill).

name: Ville De Nantes
description: Dark Red blotched White. Medium to large, semidouble with upright, fimbriated petals. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Donckelarii'). (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Lady Kay'). (France 1910 - Heurtin, Nantes).

name: Ville De Nantes Red
description: Solid Red variation of 'Ville de Nantes'.

name: Villes Delight
description: Crimson. Medium, semidouble. Slow growth. (Saluenensis × Japonica hybrid × Japonica 'Ville De Nantes'). (N.Z. 1981 - Jury).

name: Vince Dooley
description: Scarlet Red with Pink stamens and anthers. Very large, single form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Red Crystal' × Japonica 'Silver Lace'). (U.S. 2004 - Homeyer).

name: Viola Simmons
description: Rose Pink. Medium to large, semidouble to loose peony form with fluffy petals. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1957 - Gerbing).

name: Viola Spragg
description: Rose to Red. Small, peony form.

name: Violet Boon
description: Red. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, open, upright growth. E-L. (Reticulata seedling). (N.Z. 1975 - Mrs. I. Berg, Whakatane).

name: Violet Bouquet
description: Violet Purple. Medium, anemone form. Vigorous, open, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1969 - Mrs. W. H. Gates, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Violette Rose
description: Lavender. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, open growth, E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' seedling). (U.S. 1970 - Feathers).

name: Virgie's Eden
description: Baby ribbon Pink with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, rose form double with incurved petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 2014 - Manson Markette, Americus, GA).

name: Virgin Of The Blessed Hill
description: See 'Vergine Di Colle Beato'.

name: Virgin's Blush
description: White flushed faintest Pink with Yellow anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Orandagasa'). (U.S. 1944 - E. A. Mellhenny [Jungle Gardens], Avery Island, LA).

name: Virgin's Dream
description: Pink. Medium, rose form double. (U.S. 1959).

name: Virginal
description: Greenish White. Medium, semidouble to anemone form. Open, upright growth. M. (Aus. 1945 - Linton).

name: Virgine Calubini
description: See 'Vergine Di Colle Beato'. • VIRGINIA ALEXANDER STANGLE - Lavender Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, loose peony form; the bloom has light airy ruffled petals. Vigorous, spreading, medium density growth. M. Cold hardy to 10°F. (U.S. 2022 - Jeanne Stangle, Slidell, LA).

name: Virginia Alfter
description: Bright Red. Medium to large, anemone form to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1984 - Alfter).

name: Virginia Alfter Variegated
description: Bright Red center petals and petaloids and White outer guard petals variation of 'Virginia Alfter. (U.S. 1984 - Alfter).'.

name: Virginia Cagle
description: Blush Pink. Medium, semidouble with three rows of large petals and three very large, upright, wavy petals in cluster of delicate stamens forming a trumpet. E. (U.S. 1960 - Rester).

name: Virginia Carlyon
description: Crimson. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, bushy growth. (England 1972 - Carlyon).

name: Virginia Darden
description: Red. Large, semidouble with crepe, irregular petals to anemone form. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1966 - W. A. Fickling, Sr., Macon, GA).

name: Virginia Davis
description: White. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1948 - H. Davis, El Monte, CA).

name: Virginia Eyler
description: Light Pink. Medium, formal double with veined petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1953 - H. B. Stanton, Savannah, GA).

name: Virginia Franco
description: White Blushed Rose and streaked and spotted Deeper Rose. Small, formal double. Upright, open, willowy growth. M. (For another form of this cultivar, see 'General Cialdini'). (Italy 1856 - Santarelli, Florence).

name: Virginia Franco Rosea
description: Sport of' Virginia Franco' - Light Pink veined deeper Pink and edged White.

name: Virginia J
description: Pink. Large, semidouble. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - J. H. Johnson, Andalusia, AL).

name: Virginia Lynn
description: Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 2017 - William & Linda Nichols. Cottonwood, AL).

name: Virginia Maddox
description: Rose Pink with Yellow anthers and Pale Yellow filaments. Large, single. Average, spreading growth. E-M. (First Lady of Georgia Series). (U.S. 2018 - Gordy).

name: Virginia Mathis
description: Veined soft Pink becoming lighter at edge. Very large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (U.S. 1985 - Pursel).

name: Virginia Mccowen
description: White shading to Light Pink at edge. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1977 - Dodd).

name: Virginia Nalle
description: White. Small, formal double. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1989 - S. and V. Faircloth, Mobile, AL).

name: Virginia Noel
description: Red with Yellow anthers. Medium, semidouble to single - cupped shape. Average growth. E-M. (U.S.).

name: Virginia Parrish
description: Red. Medium to large, loose peony form with interspersed stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1963 - Dr. A. C. Tuck, Thomasville, GA).

name: Virginia R.
description: Pink. Small, formal double. (Saluenensis seedling). (U.S. 1983 - Kramer).

name: Virginia R. Variegated
description: Pink and White variation of 'Virginia R.. (U.S. 1983 - Kramer).'.

name: Virginia Rich
description: Cream center to White to Light Pink to Orchid on edge. Small, rose form double with large, round petals on outer edge, becoming smaller toward center. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1958 - Wheeler).

name: Virginia Robinson
description: Light Orchid Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1957 - Nuccio's).

name: Virginia Robinson Variegated
description: Light Orchid Pink blotched White variation of 'Virginia Robinson'.

name: Virginia Smith
description: Deep Rose Pink. Medium, peony form. Average, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1986 - W. L. Smith, Tylertown, MS).

name: Virginia Sunrise
description: Red blotched White with Yellow anthers and Pink filaments. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2012 - Habel).

name: Virginia W. Cutter
description: Red. Large, anemone form. Vigorous growth. M. Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' x Lutchuensis 'Ackerman's 63-32'). (U.S. 1972 - Dr. R. K. Cutter, Berkeley CA).

name: Virginia Womack
description: Light Pink. Medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. E. (Hybrid 'Felice Harris' x unknown pollen parent). (U.S 1976 - Dr. R. K. Womack).

name: Viva
description: Red. Large, single. (U.S. 1959 - Nuccio's).

name: Vivian Jones
description: Light Red and White in varying degrees. Medium, formal double. Average growth. M-L. (U.S. 1959 - C. S. Jones, Elizabeth City, NC).

name: Vivian Oehlman
description: White. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1984 - Mrs. H. Johnson, Madison, FL).

name: Vogthorstar
description: Deep Magenta Red to Deep Purple fading to Gray as the bloom ages from the edges out. Small to medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. E. (U.S. 2015 - Carrie Lee Pierson Schwartz).

name: Volcano
description: Scarlet Red. Large, anemone form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M-L. (N.Z. 1992 - Haydon).

name: Volunteer
description: Bright Strawberry Pink with a darker center, edged with Pale Pink at petal and petaloids' border. Medium, anemone form. Slow, dense, upright growth. E-L. (N.Z. 2003 - Mark Jury).

name: Vonnie Cave
description: Pale Cream, flushed Pink on reverse side of sepals. Miniature, single or semidouble form. Average, open and spreading growth. E. (Pitardii seedling). (N.Z. 2004 - Peter Cave).

name: Vosper's Rose
description: Soft Pink shading to petal edges. Medium, semidouble with upright center petals and petaloids in center. Vigorous, compact growth. M. (N.Z. 1959 - Mrs. J. Vosper, Tirau).

name: Voyant
description: Blood Red. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. (U.S. 1957 - G. Willis, Thomasville, GA).

name: Vulcan
description: Deep Fiery Red. Large to very large, semidouble to peony form with irregular petals to formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1958 - Wilson).

name: Vulcan Variegated
description: Red dotted and blotch-White variation of "Vulcan'.
